access.translation[0].definitions[0].def: the right to enter a place, use something, see someone etc
access.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Access to the papers is restricted to senior management.
Cats should always have access to fresh, clean water.
access.translation[0].definitions[1].def: how easy or difficult it is for people to enter a public building, to reach a place, or talk to someone
access.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: We’re trying to improve access for disabled visitors.
a villa with easy access to the sea
access.translation[0].definitions[2].def: the way you use to enter a building or reach a place
access.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: Access is by means of a small door on the right.
Access to the restrooms is through the foyer.
access.translation[0].definitions[3].def: the legal right to see and spend time with your children, a prisoner, an official etc
access.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: My ex-husband has access to the children once a week.
access.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to find information, especially on a computer
access.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: Users can access their voice mail remotely.
access.translation[2].definitions[0].def: a former type of credit card in the UK which is now known as Mastercard
access.translation[3].definitions[0].def: the right to sell goods to a particular market or country without breaking any laws or agreements
access.translation[3].definitions[0].exa: Japan agreed to allow foreign manufacturers of satellite equipment equal access to the Japanese market.
access.translation[3].definitions[1].def: the way in which you are able to find information held on a computer
access.translation[3].definitions[1].exa: In order to simplify access to the data, the computer program enables users to specify their own requirements.
access.translation[3].definitions[2].def: when you are allowed to see official documents
access.translation[3].definitions[2].exa: The National Union of Teachers has proposed that parents should have access to their children’s files.
access.translation[3].definitions[3].def: the ability to buy a product or make use of a service
access.translation[3].definitions[3].exa: The move is intended to widen the access to credit.
Many poorer residents have no access to health care.
access.translation[3].definitions[4].def: the right to remove money from where it is invested in order to use it
access.translation[3].definitions[4].exa: Policyholders often feel more confident if they have access to their funds.
access.translation[4].definitions[0].def: to find information, especially on a computer
access.translation[4].definitions[0].exa: The software enables each client to access data from other databases.
access.translation[4].definitions[1].def: to be able to use something
access.translation[4].definitions[1].exa: Many customers now access their accounts using the internet.
